caption: It does look cool .. but after experiencing Warner bros in LA California and Universal studios in Florida I knew nothing was going to come close to the real thing so I opted  out of going, plus tickets were sold out for the time I needed. So maybe for the best üôåüèº
Very big cinema with long waiting times in the front. Their grand rex is great if you want to watch a movie on a big screen and enjoy being surrounded by many people.

Only for cinema lovers and looking for having fun. Amazing! We participated in the shooting of a king Kong movie. We loved all the animations. The tour is available in many languages and starts every five minutes, so we could enjoy it just in our own. A cer nice surprise. A pity no pictures are allowed

I absolutely recommend this place to cinema fans or those who wants to get a immersive experience into the movie making world. Be aware: don‚Äôt expect too in-depth knowledge from this automatic tour. It‚Äôs going to touch: special effect, voice over, history of projection, iconic movie scenes, bizarre walkway, etc. Yes, it‚Äôs an automatic tour. There‚Äôs only audio guide on the loud speaker. All doors and sequence will be automatically revealed to you. I only missed one spot because I was lost but it‚Äôs still full of wonders and surprises. I would definitely revisit it next time and be more prepared. Please prepare yourself for acting üé≠ and creativity before you visit or relax and be spontaneous.

The tour was much better than I expected, fully automated, just following the audio directions and taking part in the interactive experience while learning the history of the Rex theatre and some processes of film making

I had a lot of fun doing this interactive VFX experience. I love the movies so this ticked all my boxes. We booked the first time for the day and as the only English speakers we got to go through it alone. Good fun. And a good price.

We just had a great experience visiting the studios. My kids and I had a lot of fun. The tour is very well organized and it‚Äôs beautiful to learn about the REX history. Highly recommended with or without kids!!! (No photos allowed. Sorry! :)
We were the only English speakers so we got to go through the tour alone. It‚Äôs fully automatic and a really fun experience for movie enthusiasts. Takes about 50 min to do the tour.
This was a fun lil interactive experience to check out here in Paris.  It‚Äôs was fun and interesting to learn about Rex studios Totally recommended checking it out
We absolutely recommend taking the tour of the cinema! We did it in English and we had a blast! Especially if you have kids or if you are with friends.
The best ever place I have ever been to. Excellent experience. Worth to have a visit.
Really nice place! loved the little tour, really enterntaining
I Love the video that they give you. It's a beautiful funny memory for you to keep forever
Very much history and fun!
Great atmosphere and movie selection
Amazing experience
Moment genial

Very pleasant visit to the studios of one of the largest cinemas in the world. We understand the history of this mythical place through a really nice guided and immersive tour. It doesn't last long but it's quite pleasant. I recommend the activity if you are passing through the neighborhood, it was pleasant

Excellent experience which I had already had the opportunity to do around ten years ago The format is very immersive Even on weekends there are small groups, there were 4 of us on a Saturday during school holidays so I think that during the week it is possible to have a session for your group only, which is very appreciable!
Exceptional cinema experience, the rooms are magnificent, the journey is interesting and funny. The screening room is really superb, I highly recommend it!

I just booked today by mistake instead of tomorrow. I immediately sent a message asking to change the date to 02/28. The reservation service, based on their conditions of sale, responded to me with a refusal. Faced with this lack of commercial spirit, I will not set foot in their home. A word to the wise, hello!

Very good visit! My boyfriend and I loved it! The history of the Grand Rex is very well explained (for young and old) and it literally plunges us into another universe! Additionally, the public is invited to participate. There are ‚Äúactivities‚Äù throughout the course (which is done in groups of 15 people).  Only downside: the waiting time at the entrance. I had anticipated by taking tickets in advance but we found ourselves waiting in line with those who didn‚Äôt have one! Plus the wait is quite long...

This interactive visit was a nice surprise. Made as a family with a great group, we laughed a lot and had a lot of fun. We found the prices of the visit and the shop attractive, which is also appreciable. An original and unforgettable moment!

Very nice team (ticket office and shop), interesting visit (be careful, you are being filmedü§™), very fun escape game to experience with a great surprise for the winners, small shop if necessary, everything is there!

The visit is relatively quick and simple. It takes about 40 minutes, and you just need to follow the doors that open and the audio indicating where to go at the next entrance. For those who like movies, this might be a good option.
We loved it!! Alright . My daughter is very happy!!

We were able to enjoy this experience for free thanks to the culture pass. My girlfriend and I were pleasantly surprised by this very interactive museum throughout our discovery. We 100% recommend this very pleasant place to do with family or friends.
To do with friends or family! Guaranteed laughter and great staging. We were made very welcome from A to Z. I recommend this outing! Well done to the whole team.

Superb experience, really original and funny. Excellent value for money. The only downside that may be encountered is the group you will be with, some not very lively people who make the final video less fun.
It was simply incredible! A full-fledged experience allowing both cinema fans and the curious to discover this extraordinary place while having fun!

Very warm welcome. A nice explanation of the visit.  The children and I loved the different paintings/scenes representing the cinema with its strings. The museum remains very dynamic and you will be at the center of a beautiful story.  A well-deserved 5 stars, well done to all.  The only downside was not having seen the famous room.

Good immersive experience!! We had a great time. The only downside is the queue with poor management of the air center. We are criticized for buying reseller tickets, telling us that it is more expensive!! Which is done because in my CE I got tickets for 6‚Ç¨50. You will need to be able to choose a time on the site even with CE tickets. This is done in ass√Ætes.
Fun activity to do as a family or as a couple, lasting about an hour
Very happy with this experience before our cinema session in the open sea! We recommend closed eyes. Very good value for money. Unforgettable!

Mixed opinion. Lots of queues, lack of organization. And even if you book online you still have to queue. Apparently it's the entrances to the escape game that slow down the entry. We go in groups of 15. It's a shame we don't go in family groups. So on the final video we didn't see my son at all. On the vocals we only hear 2.3 people from the group. My son was disappointed.

Very good experience with very good value for money. The studio visit and the escape game are complementary. We did both one after the other and we loved it. A big thank you to the two gentlemen who work there and take the time to explain everything with a smile, the welcome was perfect. We recommend the experience.
Very pleasant receptionist, we did the rex studio, as well as the escape game, it's interesting to delve into the depths of this legendary place of the 7th art.

An INCREDIBLE experience! Being an unconditional fan of the world of Cinema and its History, this visit was exceptional! Two of us came, early in the afternoon on a sunny Wednesday, we had absolutely no wait and we even had the entire immersive exhibition to ourselves! I highly recommend it for anyone who is a fan of the History of Cinema and curious to know behind the scenes! A little extra for the lady at reception who was very pleasant!  Online and on-site ticketing
